sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European leaders commemorate former Pope Benedict XVI, who has died aged 95.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Deadly Russian strikes pound Ukraine's capital Kiev, and Putin says he won't give in to the West in his New Year's address.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France, the UK and Spain slap restrictions on travellers from China as the country experiences a large coronavirus wave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Bells rang out in St Peter's Square in Rome on Saturday for the former Pope Benedict XVI, who died aged 95.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Benedict XVI led the church for almost eight years, until becoming the first pontiff in six hundred years to resign from the job in 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The funerals will be on Thursday this coming week, Thursday the 5th of January, at 9.30 on St. Peter's Square and they will be presided over by Pope Francis. And as we already told you this morning, from the morning of Monday the body of the Pope Emeritus will be in the Basilica of St. Peter's where the faithful can go with their prayers for a last meeting with the Pope Emeritus to greet him and to say goodbye.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European leaders have taken to social media to commemorate the former Pope, including German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who described Benedict XVI as a special church leader and clever theologian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Italian Prime Minister Giorgio Maloney called the former Pope a giant of faith and reason, while French President Emmanuel Macron wrote that Benedict XVI worked with soul and intelligence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said he was saddened to learn of the news.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis will preside over the funeral in St Peter's Square on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least one person has been killed and 20 injured in the latest barrage of Russian strikes

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: on Ukraine's capital, according to Kiev's mayor Vitaly Klitschko.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Among the injured, 14 have been taken to hospital and six were treated at the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's military commander said 12 missiles fired at Kyiv were intercepted by air defenses. Meanwhile, the war is grinding on in the east. Ukrainian troops are battling hard in Kramina, while Russian forces are pounding Bakhmut in the Donetsk region, where President Vladimir Zelensky said was the scene of some of the war's fiercest fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin claimed that Russia would never give in to the West's attempts to use Ukraine as a tool to destroy his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the Russian president's nine-minute New Year's message, he accused the West of provoking Moscow and said Russia was fighting in Ukraine to get true independence for its people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France, the UK and Spain are among the latest countries to have announced restrictions on travellers from China. One week before Beijing had planned to lift Covid travel restrictions after almost three years, international health authorities are concerned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In a tweet, the head of the World Health Organization has asked Chinese authorities for transparency and regular data sharing for a proper risk assessment Chinese authorities met with WHO officials on Friday a spokesman said China will strengthen communication with relevant countries, provide relevant service and guarantee for Chinese citizens outbound travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The virus has swept through the country as China has turned its back on its strict zero-Covid policy, which has long kept down cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some experts estimate that there may be as many as 9,000 daily deaths now nationwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: History in the making that's how Saudi Arabian football club al-nasa terms the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: signing of Cristiano Ronaldo on a two and a half year deal the 37 year old Portuguese international has been without a club since his contract was terminated with Manchester United at the end of November. The five-time Ballon d'Or winner will receive a salary estimated at 200 million euros, a record for the little-known Saudi Arabian League.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ronaldo has said he's looking forward to discovering a new football league in a different country.
